introduction: Your elbow started hurting after you played tennis some time back. You took some Aleve, but the pain is not going away.
question: what can be done for severe elbow pain?

answers.text: Elbow pain may be caused by inflammation and injuries. If your elbow is just sore, try resting, placing a heating pad or hot pack around your elbow, gently stretching your muscles, or wearing a brace.
Give yourself a few days rest and take over-the-counter pain relievers. If this doesn't help, your doctor may suggest physical therapy, steroid injections, and surgery.
Gently try to move the elbow and increase your range of motion. If this hurts or you cannot move the elbow, contact your health care provider.

Treatment depends on:The location and type of injury, and how bad it is.How long ago the injury occurred.Your age, health condition, and activities, such as work, sports, or hobbies. Alternative treatments that show promise include acupuncture, High-Intensity Laser Therapy (HILT), botulinum toxin and bone marrow injections.

task.question: Your elbow started hurting after you played tennis some time back. You took some Aleve, but the pain is not going away. Given the answers about severe elbow pain you found at the NLM site, what will you do:
options: Give your elbow some rest, apply hot or cold, take more painkillers
Ask your doctor for steroid injection
Ask your doctor about the experimental treatments such as acupuncture
Ask your doctor to refer you to see a surgeon
